Game.Core

Class Rules

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.Core.Rules
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RulesInterface

    public class Rules
extends java.lang.Object
implements RulesInterface
    Rules is the class where the game rules are defined, this includes what cards are allowed, if a player can say uno, if a player should be penalized, when a player have won etc.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    vikfll-0

      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> allowedStartingCardValues
      Allowed values of the starting cards, used to only allow numbered cards between 0-9.

      • playerCanPlayCards

        public boolean playerCanPlayCards(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cardWantToPlay,
                                  Card activeCard,
                                  remotePlayer player)
        Check if a player can play multiple cards. Checks so that player does not finish the game by playing multiple cards and checks so that the different cards adhere to the requirements set up in the description.
        Specified by:
        playerCanPlayCards in interface RulesInterface
        Parameters:
        cardWantToPlay - Arraylist of cards that wants to be played
        activeCard - The active card
        player - The player that wants to play the cards
        Returns:
        True if possible, false otherwise.
